author: gsweet
title: Watford legend Graham Taylor to be honoured with statue at Vicarage Road after his death aged 72
text:
5 Graham Taylor…Watford are to erect a statue in his honour Taylor managed the club in two spells, first taking them from the then Division Four into the top flight and later gaining promotion to the Premier League from the Championship. Keep up to date with ALL the football gossip and transfers on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary He also managed England from 1990 until 1993. Taylor’s funeral was attended by hundreds of football celebrities and fans, who lined the streets. Reuters Fans lined the streets for Taylor’s funeral last month PA:Press Association Sir Alex Ferguson was among the mourners 
A statue celebrating his footballing career will be erected at Vicarage Road and 
a pre-season tribute fixture in Taylor’s memory is also on the cards. Crowds bring Watford to a standstill for Graham Taylor's funeral Related Stories Ars out? Under-fire Arsene Wenger finally admits he could leave Arsenal THIS season as he faces decision over future HOME ALONE Liverpool striker Daniel Sturridge sent home from Kop's warm weather training camp in Spain with virus JESUS UNDER KNIFE Gabriel Jesus has surgery in Barcelona to repair fractured metatarsal and faces eight weeks out IMPS IN A HUDL High-tech Lincoln City warn Burnley they've figured out how to pull off FA Cup shock DOUBLE BUBBLE Mark Clattenburg on £500,000-a-year TAX FREE along with other benefits after quitting Prem for Saudi Arabia TEMPLE OF BOOM Zlatan Ibrahimovic boasts he is the Indiana Jones of football after plundering hat-trick 

Watford said it would be working on the plans with fans' representatives and the borough council. 
On its website, Watford FC described the proposed statue and pre-season match as "two significant tributes...t o remember Watford's greatest ever manager". Getty Images Taylor and chairman Elton John took Watford into the top flight Reuters 5 Taylor was proud to be awarded the OBE 
Taylor also guided the club to the only FA Cup final of their history - a 2-0 defeat against Everton in 1984 - and European football in the UEFA Cup. 
The former Grimsby Town player also bossed Lincoln City, Aston Villa and Wolves. Watford fans at Vicarage Road pay tribute to Graham Taylor with minute's applause
